get.description: Gets all of the Alerts for the currently authenticated user. Alerts occur when a Trigger's conditions are met.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all alerts.

200.description: The list of Alerts owned by the current User.

get.description: Gets the metadata for a single Alert; referenced by ID.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The ID of the Alert to retrieve metadata for.

200.description: The Alert metadata.

delete.description: Deletes an Alert; referenced by ID.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The ID of the Alert to Delete.

200.description: OK

get.description: Sends a simple GET Query for fetching lists of Piazza Data.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Datasets.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Filter for the username that published the service.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

post.description: Loads data into the Piazza Core metadata holdings. Piazza can either host the data, or reflect an external location where the data is stored. Data must be loaded into Piazza before core components such as the Service Controller, or other external services, are able to consume that data.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The description, location, and metadata for the Data to be loaded into Piazza.

200.description: The ID of the Job created to handle the Loading of the Data.

post.summary: Load a Data File into Piazza
post.description: Loads a local user data file into the Piazza Core metadata holdings. This functions the same as /data endpoint, but a file is specified instead of a URI.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The Load Job metadata. This is the identical model to the LoadJob as specified in the body of the /data request. It is only noted as a string type here because of a Swagger deficiency.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded.

200.description: The ID of the Job created to handle the Loading of the Data.

get.description: Sends a simple GET Query for fetching lists of Piazza Data.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Datasets.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

post.summary: Query Metadata in Piazza Data holdings
post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Search component, that allow users to search for loaded data. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords, spatial metadata, or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Query string for the Search component.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

get.description: Reads all metadata for a Data item that has been previously loaded into Piazza.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: ID of the Data item to pull Metadata for.

200.description: Metadata describing the Data Item that matches the specified Data ID. Includes release metadata, and spatial metadata, etc.

post.description: This will update the metadata for a specific data item. Non-null values will overwrite. This will only update the corresponding 'metadata' field in the Data item. Spatial metadata, and file information cannot be updated. For cases where spatial data or file data needs to change, an re-load of the data must be done.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: ID of the Data item to update the Metadata for.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: The Resource Metadata object containing the updated metadata fields to write.

200.description: Confirmation that the Metadata has been updated.

delete.description: Deletes an entry to Data that has been previously loaded into Piazza. If the file was hosted by Piazza, then that file will also be deleted.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: ID of the Data item to Delete.

200.description: Confirmation of delete

get.summary: Obtain a list of all GeoServer deployments held by Piazza.
get.description: Data can be made available through the Piazza GeoServer as WMS/WCS/WFS. This must be done through POSTing to the /deployment endpoint. This endpoint will return a list of all Deployed resources.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Deployments.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

post.summary: Obtain a GeoServer deployment for a Data Resource object
post.description: Data that has been loaded into Piazza can be deployed to GeoServer. This will copy the data to the GeoServer data directory (if needed), or point to the Piazza PostGIS; and then create a WMS/WCS/WFS layer (as available) for the service. Only data that has been internally hosted within Piazza can be deployed.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The Data ID and deployment information for creating the Deployment

200.description: The Job ID for the specified Deployment. This could be a long-running process to copy the data over to GeoServer, so a new Job is spawned.

get.description: Fetches the Metadata for a Piazza Deployment.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: ID of the Deployment to Fetch

200.description: The metadata about the Deployment. Contains the unique ID of the deployment; the Data ID that it represents; and server information regarding the access of the deployed service (likely GeoServer) including the GetCapabilities document.

delete.description: If a user wishes to delete a deployment before its lease time is up (and automatic deletion could take place) then this endpoint provides a way to do so manually.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: ID of the Deployment to Delete.

200.description: Confirmation that the deployment has been deleted.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all Events.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The name of the event type to filter by.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The field to use for sorting.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

200.description: The list of Events.

post.summary: Creates an Event for the Event Type
post.description: Fires an Event with the Piazza Workflow component. Events must conform to the specified Event Type.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The Event JSON object.

200.description: The ID of the newly created Event

get.description: Gets a specific Event by it's ID, that corresponds with the Event Type.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The Event ID for the event to retrieve.

200.description: The requested Event.

delete.description: Deletes a specific Event by it's ID, that corresponds with the Event Type.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The Event ID for the event to delete.

200.description: Confirmation of delete.

get.description: Lists all Event Types that have been registered with the Piazza Workflow service.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The field to use for sorting.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

200.description: The list of Event Types.

post.description: Defines an Event Type with the Workflow component, that defines a schema that Events can conform to and be fired for.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The Event Type information. This defines the Schema for the Events that must be followed.

200.description: The ID of the newly created Event Type

get.description: Returns the metadata for a specific Event Type by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: eventTypeId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Event Type.

200.description: The Event Type metadata.

delete.description: Deletes a specific Event Type, specified by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: eventTypeId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Event Type to delete.

200.description: Confirmation of Event Type deletion.

get.description: Gets the Bytes of Data loaded into Piazza. Only works for data that is stored internally by Piazza.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: The ID of the Data to download.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: Specify the name of the file that the user wishes to retrieve the data as. This will set the content-disposition header.

200.description: The downloaded data file.

get.description: Fetches the Status for a single Piazza Job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: ID of the Job to Fetch

200.description: Information regarding the requested Job. At bare minimum, this will contain the Job ID of the Job that has been spawned as a result of the POSTed message. If more information is available, such as Status, it will also be included.

put.description: Repeats a previously submitted Job. This will clone the original Job, and run it again with identical parameters, using the requesting users authentication in the new Job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: ID of the Job to Repeat

200.description: A new Job ID that corresponds to the cloned Job in Piazza.

delete.description: Cancels a Running Job. If the Job is already completed in some way, then cancellation will not occur.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: ID of the Job to cancel.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Details for the cancellation of the Job.

200.description: The Job has requested to be cancelled. This may take some time, as the process may not be in an easily cancelled state at the time the request is made.

get.description: Retrieves the list of available Services currently registered to this Piazza system.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Services.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Filter for the username that published the service.

200.description: The list of Services registered to Piazza.

post.description: Creates a new Service with the Piazza Service Controller; that can be invoked through Piazza jobs with Piazza data.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The metadata for the service. This includes the URL, parameters, inputs and outputs. It also includes other release metadata such as classification and availability.

200.description: The ID of the newly created Service

get.description: Retrieves the list of available Services currently registered to this Piazza system.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Services.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

200.description: The list of Services registered to Piazza.

post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Search component, that allow users to search for registered Services. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords, spatial metadata, or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The Query string for the Search component.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

get.description: Retrieves the information and metadata for the specified Service matching the ID.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The ID of the Service to retrieve.

200.description: The Service object.

put.description: Updates a Service Metadata, with the Service to updated specified by its ID.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The ID of the Service to Update.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The Service Metadata. All properties specified in the Service data here will overwrite the existing properties of the Service.

200.description: Confirmation of Update.

delete.description: Unregisters a service by its ID.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The ID of the Service to unregister.

parameters.name: softDelete
parameters.description: softDelete

200.description: Confirmation of Deleted.

get.description: Lists all of the defined Triggers in the Piazza Workflow component.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all triggers.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

200.description: The list of Triggers.

post.description: Creates a new Trigger with the Piazza Workflow component.

parameters.name: trigger
parameters.description: The Trigger information to register. This defines the Conditions that must be hit in order for some Action to occur.

200.description: The ID of the newly created Trigger

get.description: Retrieves the Trigger definition for the Trigger matching the specified Trigger ID.

parameters.name: triggerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Trigger to retrieve.

200.description: Retrieves the Trigger definition for the Trigger matching the specified Trigger ID.

delete.description: Deletes a Trigger with the Workflow component. This Trigger will no longer listen for conditions for events to fire.

parameters.name: triggerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Trigger to delete.

200.description: OK

post.description: Creates a Piazza Job to execute a registered service in the system, with the specified parameters.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Payload that describes the Service to be executed, and the inputs for that service.

200.description: The Job ID for the execution of the Service. This can be queried using Job Status to track progress and, when available, fetch the result object.

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored data
The media type of the stored data

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

data.description: The array of Data Resource results.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

id.description: The unique identifier of this Event Type.

mapping.description: The map of key-value pairs that define the properties of this Event Type. The key is the name of the property, and the value is the type of that property. Valid types are 'string' and 'integer'.

name.description: The human-readable name for this Event Type.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

capabilitiesUrl.description: Fully qualified URL for accessing the GetCapabilities action for the deployment service.

dataId.description: The unique identifier of the Data that this deployment hosts.

host.description: The host name for the deployment server.

id.description: The unique identifier for this Deployment.

layer.description: The layer name for the hosted service on the deployment server.

port.description: The port number for the deployment server.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

availability.description: String to describe the status (UP, UNAVAILABLE (something is going on), DOWN (It has been turned off)

clientCertRequired.description: Is a client certificate required?   Could be a user certificate or computer certificate

contacts.description: Name, e-mail and phone number of point of contact (String concatenated together)

credentialsRequired.description: Are credentials required to access this service?

format.description: In case of ComplexData, Format defines the allowed input representation

preAuthRequired.description: Is preauthorization required before using the service?  (e.g. do users need to sign a user agreement, etc.)

qos.description: Quality level of the service (Production, Development)

location.description: The location of the data. Used to describe S3 stores, or folder shares, for where the data is located.

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored data

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

jobType.description: Polymorphically describes the information defining what actions this Job should take.

result.description: A reference to the Result of the Job. This could be a Resource ID, or a Service ID, in certain cases. Or perhaps an error if the Job encountered an error during processing.

status.description: The status of the Job. Submitted, Running, Success, Error, or Failure.

submittedBy.description: The name of the user who submitted the Job.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

count.description: The number of results that matched the query.

per_page.description: The current number of results returned per page.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

condition.description: Defines the trigger conditions, the query replacements, and the Job to execute upon this object becoming Triggered.

id.description: The unique identifier for this Event.

job.description: The Template of the Job to be executed when the conditions are met.

title.description: The human-readable description of what this Trigger intends to accomplish.

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored data
The media type of the stored data

data.description: The Description of the Data being loaded, including metadata, and the path to the data.

host.description: Dictates if Piazza should internally host the data or not. If set to true, then the data will be stored in Piazza's data holdings. If false, then Piazza will point to the location of the data, but will not store the data internally.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

data.description: The parameter inputs for Service execution.

jobId.description: The JobID created for executing the service.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

eventtype_ids.description: The array of Event Type IDs.

databaseTableName.description: The PostGIS table name that contains the Shapefile data.

location.description: The location of the data. Used to describe S3 stores, or folder shares, for where the data is located.

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored data

location.description: The location of the data. Used to describe S3 stores, or folder shares, for where the data is located.

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored data

coordinateReferenceSystem.description: The CRS (Coordinate Reference System) of the data.

epsgCode.description: The EPSG code of the CRS.

numFeatures.description: The number of features contained in the resource.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

contractUrl.description: URL to the schema or contract to interface with the service, such as a Swagger file, or documentation.

method.description: The HTTP method used to invoke this user service.

serviceId.description: The unique identifier of the user servie.

url.description: The URL to the user service to be executed.

dataId.description: The ID of the data to download.

dataType.description: Polymorphically defines the information specific to this Data Resource, based on its format.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

serviceId.description: The ID of the Service to Execute.

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored data

id.description: The ID of the item that has been created from the request.

data.description: The populated values for the Key-value pairs defined by the Event Type's 'mapping' dictionary. Each value in this dictionary must be populated here under this 'data' property.

eventtype_id.description: The unique identifier of the Event Type whose schema this Event conforms to.

id.description: The unique identifier for this Event.

eventId.description: The unique identifier for the Event that triggered the Trigger.

id.description: The unique identifier for this Alert.

triggerId.description: The unique identifier for the Trigger that was hit.

jobId.description: The ID of the Job that has been created from the request.

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query.

type.description: Legacy. This will eventually be removed.

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored data

percentComplete.description: The percentage complete for the Job, in whole numbers, out of 100 percent

timeRemaining.description: The last value for the Time Remaining as reported by the processor of this Job.

timeSpent.description: The amount of time spent by the processor of this Job, according to that processor.
